title: Lesson 8
paragraph: Verbs in this lesson relate to money, planning, and promises — essential for talking about transactions, decisions, and commitments.

words.meaning: to give money for goods or services
words.example: Please pay the bill at the counter.

words.meaning: to choose or to take hold of something
words.example: Pick a card from the deck.

words.meaning: to decide on and arrange in advance
words.example: We plan to visit Kyoto next month.

words.meaning: to like one thing more than another
to assure someone that one will definitely do something
to keep someone or something safe from harm
words.example: Wear a helmet to protect your head.
They provided food for the refugees.

words.meaning: to apply force to move something toward oneself
words.example: Pull the door to open it.

words.meaning: to apply force to move something away
to arrive at or attain something
words.example: We reached the summit at sunset.

words.meaning: to be given or presented with something
